title: Looking for a script similar to the Unilever logo
content:
althought hand done, i'm looking for a similar face to the new unilever logo

[http://www.identityworks.com/reviews/2004/unilever\_logo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20141017155105/http:/www.identityworks.com/reviews/2004/unilever_logo.gif "http://www.identityworks.com/reviews/2004/unilever\_logo.gif")
author: flex

comments.content:
You are going to be hard-pressed to find something like this, especially with that much detail.

[Sorta](http://web.archive.org/web/20141017155105/http:/store.adobe.com/type/browser/T/T_novelty.html) at Adobe.

[Kinda](http://web.archive.org/web/20141017155105/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/keyword/letterbat/) at Myfonts

[Maybe](http://web.archive.org/web/20141017155105/http:/www.identifont.com/show?3DS) at Identifont.

If you do find something, will you let us know. I'd certainly be curious.

Are you looking for the U or the script underneath?

If it's the script, try looking at [Part 7](http://web.archive.org/web/20141017155105/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script07Pg1.html) of Mike Yanega's Script ID Guide.

- Lex

The logo was co-created by [Miles Newlyn](http://web.archive.org/web/20141017155105/http:/newlyn.com/flash.htm) for [Wolff Olins](http://web.archive.org/web/20141017155105/http:/www.wolff-olins.com/).

troubleman. yes, he's brilliant.

a friend was looking for a typface similar to that which he created for the unilever script.
Yves, where is the FAQ. Let the questioner get a link to Mike's work and do the research themselves first.
